revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-21 13:51:54.000000000', 'message': "Improve first time download of ubuntu images

If a cached copy of the file doesn't exist, cache_url() passes a
non-existent path to -z/--time-cond and you see this warning:

 Warning: Illegal date format for -z, --timecond (and not a file name).
 Warning: Disabling time condition. See curl_getdate(3) for valid date syntax.

It works just fine, but the warning is ugly.

Change-Id: Ic6f13a2c596b988308d7fca9cd1745e5d48ae5fb
"}, {'created': '2013-06-21 13:51:54.000000000', 'message': "Improve first time download of ubuntu images.

If a cached copy of the file doesn't exist, cache_url() passes a
non-existent path to -z/--time-cond and you see this warning:

 Warning: Illegal date format for -z, --timecond (and not a file name).
 Warning: Disabling time condition. See curl_getdate(3) for valid date syntax.

It works just fine, but the warning is ugly.

Change-Id: Ic6f13a2c596b988308d7fca9cd1745e5d48ae5fb
"}]
commit_message:
Improve first time download of ubuntu images.

If a cached copy of the file doesn't exist, cache_url() passes a
non-existent path to -z/--time-cond and you see this warning:

 Warning: Illegal date format for -z, --timecond (and not a file name).
 Warning: Disabling time condition. See curl_getdate(3) for valid date syntax.

It works just fine, but the warning is ugly.

Change-Id: Ic6f13a2c596b988308d7fca9cd1745e5d48ae5fb

[{'created': '2013-06-20 09:21:40.000000000', 'message': 'Document the OVS service restart

When installing Quantum OVS agent, the OVS service might not be properly
started due to a missing kernel module (compiled using DKMS). Make sure
that the service is (re)started before restarting the agent.

Change-Id: Ic049b1698c2176b2adfa5f32ca6253b6484d966a
'}]
commit_message:
Document the OVS service restart

When installing Quantum OVS agent, the OVS service might not be properly
started due to a missing kernel module (compiled using DKMS). Make sure
that the service is (re)started before restarting the agent.

Change-Id: Ic049b1698c2176b2adfa5f32ca6253b6484d966a

Was net-id always required? The clients is not pinned to a specific release, so if this was a new requirement in Grizzly we need to make sure this is backwards compatible with Folsom etc.'}, {'account_id': 7307, 'date': '2013-06-18 11:14:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi Joe,

Looking at https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py#L641, it appears that you need to specify at least net-id or port-id.  If you specify both, net-id is ignored (and vice-versa).  The same is valid for Folsom/Grizzly.

I think there are other areas of the nova code where you can't specify net-id and port-id together (for example attaching network to existing instance), however as far as booting an instance is concerned that condition does not exist.

I will update my branch to reflect this.

-Matt"}, {'account_id': 7307, 'date': '2013-06-18 11:25:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7307, 'date': '2013-06-18 11:33:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-18 12:24:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

commit_message:
Update help for --nic opt and make net-id or port-id required

Commit updates help string for --nic option to reflect that specifying
net-id and port-id keys are optional but that at least one is
required.  Additionally, we change _boot in novaclient/v1_1/shell.py
to raise an exception if random keys are added to --nic string and if
--nic string does not contain net-id or port-id keys.

Change-Id: Icf94c395bd09160aa6a1b849eb464d72e410e1ae
Fixes: bug #1052356
Fixes: bug #1191139

commit_message:
Cleanup certificate API extension

Fixes a couple of minor issues with the v2 and v3 versions
of the certificate API extension identified during the
v2->v3 port
* Removes unused CertificatesTemplate class
* Corrects doc strings for a couple of methods

Change-Id: If022d2393ceab5ce7e6311c92a6f52b6325039bc

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-21 13:33:58.000000000', 'message': 'Switch from pep8 to flake8/hacking.

Use flake8/hacking, as is standard in other OpenStack projects, but
disable new checks -- they will be enabled in later patches.

Flake8 catches many useful things
http://flake8.readthedocs.org/en/2.0/warnings.html, and hacking enforces
the OpenStack Style guidelines, including things like one import per
line and alphabetical imports in order to make merging easier.

Change-Id: Ib43f7a6790bc17c0b4efdda0a5f891b5a90303c4
'}]
commit_message:
Switch from pep8 to flake8/hacking.

Use flake8/hacking, as is standard in other OpenStack projects, but
disable new checks -- they will be enabled in later patches.

Flake8 catches many useful things
http://flake8.readthedocs.org/en/2.0/warnings.html, and hacking enforces
the OpenStack Style guidelines, including things like one import per
line and alphabetical imports in order to make merging easier.

Change-Id: Ib43f7a6790bc17c0b4efdda0a5f891b5a90303c4

commit_message:
Use the source-repository interface.

Use the new source-repository interface to git clone
source repository.

Also there was a few thing in this element that needed to be fixed.
o url to the git repo wasn't curren't.
o pip and git are also dependencies that needed to be installed.

Change-Id: Ieb7be6576fc909aa4bba0233b7b81cab03395d76

The must_have_launched decorator constraint is a great idea.  

We've had instances all go into an ERROR state after a hypervisor reboot when the resume_state_on_host_boot function failed to restart everything.  Having this patch in place would have allowed us to mitigate a manual DB update.

I'll definitely +1 this as soon as the tests pass."}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-06-09 09:44:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck bug 1185834'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-09 10:37:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 1525, 'date': '2013-06-09 16:43:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Again, I really like where this is going but I'm not so sure about allowing volume detach.

In many cases volume detachments will actually fail if an instance is an ERROR state.  It's one of those operations we want to make sure we complete, otherwise we end up making an already in-use volume available to attach to another instance.

Please let me know if my concern is invalid and what I may be overlooking."}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-06-10 08:23:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

instance that has booted successfully at least once
so this change extends the instance state check
logic to include evidence that the instance has
been successfully started at least once.

This enables more operations to be allowed in
against instances in an Error state.  For example
reboot and rebuild are useful recover options for

instance which has never booted successfully are
delete and force_delete.  Soft delete is not
allowed, as the restore is in effect a start unless
there is specific virt driver support.

In addition the following actions are now allowed
against instances in an Error state providing the
instance has booted at least once:  Reboot, Rebuild,
and Rescue.

Fixes bug:   1183946

commit_message:
Allow reboot or rebuild from vm_state=Error

In general most operations are only valid on an
instance that has booted successfully at least once
so this change extends the instance state check
logic to include evidence that the instance has
been successfully started at least once.

This enables more operations to be allowed in
against instances in an Error state.  For example
reboot and rebuild are useful recover options for
an instance which has reached an error state, but
not if the instance failed during its initial build.

With this change the only actions allowed on an
instance which has never booted successfully are
delete and force_delete.  Soft delete is not
allowed, as the restore is in effect a start unless
there is specific virt driver support.

In addition the following actions are now allowed
against instances in an Error state providing the
instance has booted at least once:  Reboot, Rebuild,
and Rescue.

Fixes bug:   1183946

Change-Id: I63fd8d2a182df5cf12754892e8076933b3b1e79f

commit_message:
Setting static ip= for baremetal PXE boot.

This patch adds a new option "pxe_network_config" to baremetal PXE driver,
if set it tells the driver to append the network configuration to the
kernel cmdline. Initramfs built with network support could then benefit
from this option and avoid the injection of network configuration files
into the image.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I61dc946f42f8a86eaad0e73b033a0d8da4a74e40

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-20 23:28:45.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid potential race condition in list_stacks assert.

Asserting that stack listing has increased by exactly 1
after a create is racy if there are other concurrent stack
operations occuring.

This replaces the assert with a check that confirms the created
stack appears in the stack list.

This race has not actually been triggered yet, but may when tempest
gains some concurrency.

Change-Id: I200efa6d3d55e403c9d9a5f3abc49ad6c024e6a9
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid potential race condition in list_stacks assert.

Asserting that stack listing has increased by exactly 1
after a create is racy if there are other concurrent stack
operations occuring.

This replaces the assert with a check that confirms the created
stack appears in the stack list.

This race has not actually been triggered yet, but may when tempest
gains some concurrency.

Change-Id: I200efa6d3d55e403c9d9a5f3abc49ad6c024e6a9

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-20 22:13:01.000000000', 'message': "Fixing scoping of instances in admin volume view

Existing code was only getting instances scoped to the user's
current token.  When calling from the admin volumes view, this
needs to get all instances to correlate volume attachments.

Changed get_volumes to pass all_tenants=True to be consistent,
cinder ignores the value anyway and only looks for the all_tenants
key.

Fixes: bug #1193002

Change-Id: I5ed2a63997126911d6657619b062acd2947d06e1
"}]
commit_message:
Fixing scoping of instances in admin volume view

Existing code was only getting instances scoped to the user's
current token.  When calling from the admin volumes view, this
needs to get all instances to correlate volume attachments.

Changed get_volumes to pass all_tenants=True to be consistent,
cinder ignores the value anyway and only looks for the all_tenants
key.

Fixes: bug #1193002

Change-Id: I5ed2a63997126911d6657619b062acd2947d06e1

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-20 16:58:02.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Initial scheduler support for instance_groups"

This reverts commit b2c17ae891b12118b9d11bf0ecc44e77956715c8.

While reviewing merged changes, I came across this one.  It's using the
conductor in a way that it shouldn't.  The scheduler has db access, so
there's no need to add the extra conductor overhead.  The best thing to
do here is to just revert for now, IMO.

Change-Id: Iaa0d67df7bb84913784d925cffebcd5f252249ea
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Initial scheduler support for instance_groups"

This reverts commit b2c17ae891b12118b9d11bf0ecc44e77956715c8.

While reviewing merged changes, I came across this one.  It's using the
conductor in a way that it shouldn't.  The scheduler has db access, so
there's no need to add the extra conductor overhead.  The best thing to
do here is to just revert for now, IMO.

Change-Id: Iaa0d67df7bb84913784d925cffebcd5f252249ea

subject: Initial scheduler support for instance_groups

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-09 14:33:27.000000000', 'message': 'Initial scheduler support for instance_groups

Shceduler support for blueprint instance-group-api-extension

The patch set adds the following:
1. conductor support for getting instances via the instance_group uuid
2. scheduler using instance_group id

WIP:-
1. missing tests
2. scheduler to use the instance group policy (at the moment this anti-affinity)

Change-Id: I4a4febc2e85d4ffc8b1579d2673fa107171a3c5b
'}, {'created': '2013-06-09 16:27:06.000000000', 'message': 'Initial scheduler support for instance_groups

Shceduler support for blueprint instance-group-api-extension

commit_message:
Initial scheduler support for instance_groups

Scheduler support for blueprint instance-group-api-extension

The patch set adds the following:
1. conductor support for getting instances via the instance_group uuid
2. conductor support for removing an instance from the instance_group
   members

In addition to this it replaces the 'group' hint with 'instance_group'.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I4a4febc2e85d4ffc8b1579d2673fa107171a3c5b

[{'account_id': 7256, 'date': '2013-06-18 18:38:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Based on out-of-band convos, my understanding is that the issue crops up when the stack name is large-ish and we're generating names for stack users. I would prefer we actually leave the client alone and make a better choice wrt generating stack user names. My suggestion is to use the stack name as the last part of the generated name and truncate there before calling the client."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-18 19:11:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

commit_message:
Unrestricted username length causing error.

When we tried to create a username in keystone with
a length > 64 characters, an error was being raised.
Only use the first 64 characters of the dynamically
generated name in this case.

Change-Id: I5a5f863d721da8d187facb48230aeab251c7d240

commit_message:
Get messages by id

This patch modifies the "get" method in the storage drivers' message
controller to allow querying a set of messages by id.

In the next patch, the WSGI transport driver will be similarly
modified to allow querying for multiple messages by ID, through
the API.

Change-Id: I3bd183438a3eaf7af6ca52a19bb804c47ac1f245
Implements: blueprint v1-api

[{'created': '2013-06-21 10:59:20.000000000', 'message': "Install git with source-repositories element.

Git isn't a dependency of this element, but is a dependency of pbr
if you are doing pip install on a git cloned directoy, because this
looks to be a fairly common pattern it makes sense to have git on the
target image.

Change-Id: I49ee3fa4eac493b9dfa379a674ab9b3390cfc89a
"}]
commit_message:
Install git with source-repositories element.

Git isn't a dependency of this element, but is a dependency of pbr
if you are doing pip install on a git cloned directoy, because this
looks to be a fairly common pattern it makes sense to have git on the
target image.

Change-Id: I49ee3fa4eac493b9dfa379a674ab9b3390cfc89a

commit_message:
Make _poll_unconfirmed_resizes() use objects

This makes the _poll_unconfirmed_resizes() periodic task use
objects for looking up the instance state information.

This patch also makes compute_confirm_resize() take instance
objects. Although this method will be obsolete after a full
conversion to objects, this makes it send a full instance object
to the conductor manager, which is then converted to a dict for
passing to compute_api (for now). This will allow a more complete
conversion of the use of it to objects, and then the dict hack
will be removed when the method itself goes away.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: I03c1a28a1bbd9732f803e140e93d214dd5c7792e

1. I move checking codes before running wsgi

commit_message:
Add xattr check for object server

This patch check checks xattr support for file system before running
object server. This could prevent user facing errors until do a PUT or
POST.

Change-Id: I755266b045032c868187680a62d97a6fdd6665ae

This patch or blueprint for it doesn't detail the full plans as well, which might help for someone looking at it from the outside."}, {'account_id': 6786, 'date': '2013-06-11 09:44:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Nirmal, thank you for the comments!

I think that we'll update bp with more details asap. As for Cinder volumes usage - it'll be optional and users will have an ability to specify some volumes configs per Hadoop cluster. By default, ephemeral drives will be used."}, {'account_id': 6786, 'date': '2013-06-11 11:36:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Update object model to support cinder volumes

Adding cinderclient to savanna utils

Add dependency: python-cinderclient

Create and attach cinder volumes

Delete and detach volumes

Fix pep8 errors

Partial implementation error handling

Partially implement blueprint attach-cinder-volume

TODO:
* Write error handling
* Hadoop configs in plugin

Change-Id: I6b952aa49616d9e05aded52d148a3bfec3c89cc2

commit_message:
Update testtools to 0.9.32

This version fixes a bug related choosing the SkipTest class with
older pythons; see
 - bug #1190951.
 - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/33769/

Change-Id: If64bd101842391d1db73addc64bd1442999dcc86

[{'created': '2013-06-20 15:12:50.000000000', 'message': 'Restore admin role to ceilometer user.

Fixes bug 1193004

The ceilometer user needs the admin role, so that the resources
(instances etc.) associated with all tenants are visible to the
ceilometer agents for metering purposes.

Change-Id: I4d8a88d2d88a11a4b408e0c68ef227ec2af2d822
'}]
commit_message:
Restore admin role to ceilometer user.

Fixes bug 1193004

The ceilometer user needs the admin role, so that the resources
(instances etc.) associated with all tenants are visible to the
ceilometer agents for metering purposes.

Change-Id: I4d8a88d2d88a11a4b408e0c68ef227ec2af2d822

commit_message:
Heap Size can be applied for Hadoop services now

* Hadoop environment parameters are now set properly
* Removed jinja usage from vanilla plugin

Fixes bug 1192820

Change-Id: Iee32e3621d2888aa8039f74563bb7da12cc3e31f

'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-06-17 10:59:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Setting [] as a default value in the param list in python is a classic gotcha as 'files' will only be initialized once, rather than per call.

Probably what's required is in the function body:

    if files is None:
        files=[]

Actually, since files=None is set in the param list of virt.disk.inject_data(), it would probably be better to
do this in _create_image():

    content=files or []

thanks"}, {'account_id': 7881, 'date': '2013-06-17 15:04:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-06-17 15:20:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
fixes nova resize bug when force_config_drive is set.

If files is None, set contents=[] when calling
instance_metadata.InstanceMetadata from within _create_image() to prevent
the method trying to iterate a NoneType.

Fixes bug 1183003

Change-Id: I0ac18ad5363ab9496fa83d231d7ec7c59d737691

commit_message:
Give alarm a physical_resource_name which need no id.

This restores previous behaviour, including workarounds for
circular dependencies.

Fixes bug: #1192814

Change-Id: I33e8e4d7806fb397553944dbd6ebb85b575b9cb5

commit_message:
Add support for specifying statistics period.

Allow the period to be be specified as an addition parameter
when retrieving statistics.

Change-Id: Ied3add404fb8b20c46a4de00f07273a6d6c4ffce

multiple times.  Added MultipleTimes() to the mock.

commit_message:
Fixing unmocked call errors

Call pool_health_monitors_get was mocked, but it is called
multiple times.  Added MultipleTimes() to the mock.

Fixes: bug #1192923

Change-Id: I127d28d7963aa823064fe2a6593823ec6e613739

commit_message:
Add general description field in image properties

It would be beneficial for us to be able to add descriptions to the
image file.

Change-Id: I8e5f9ce423f1bc76e559ffb437f255fd9717902e
Fixes: bug #1180861

'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2013-06-13 09:51:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Would be great to file a Launchpad bug that would explain the use case for this, and reference it in the commit message. This changes the semantics of RegExpFilter so i'd like to make sure we have a good use case for this.

Also if we do exact matching on userargs[0], shouldn't we exclude it from the regexp-style matching ? What happens if we specify "foo+bar" ? It can't pass both tests.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-21 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Skip RegExp Match on the arg0 in RegExpFilter

Tighten checks in RegExpFilter to ensure that the first
argument needs to match exact.

Change-Id: I902f20104d1e44edac64486e90884a95b60e2ef3

[{'created': '2013-06-04 09:44:35.000000000', 'message': 'z/VM driver - Other helper functions

Includes other helper functions that make z/VM driver initialized
correctly, contains:

list_instances:
Dump xCAT zvm table, returns a list of xCAT nodes that on top of
zvm host that associated with current compute node.

get_available_resource:
Get host information via xCAT "rinv <host>", format and return.

get_info:
Get z/VM instance information from xCAT.

destroy:
Destroy z/VM instance by delete xCAT node and z/VM userid.

And add internal method _check_requried_ops to check all required
options.

Part 3 of zvm-plugin

Change-Id: I21b5cd5da2bbf19bb70d8b2a6de596514c76df4c

commit_message:
z/VM driver - Other helper functions

Includes other helper functions that make z/VM driver initialized
correctly, contains:

list_instances:
Dump xCAT zvm table, returns a list of xCAT nodes that on top of
zvm host that associated with current compute node.

get_available_resource:
Get host information via xCAT "rinv <host>", format and return.

get_info:
Get z/VM instance information from xCAT.

destroy:
Destroy z/VM instance by delete xCAT node and z/VM userid.

Part 3 of blueprint zvm-plugin

Change-Id: I21b5cd5da2bbf19bb70d8b2a6de596514c76df4c

'}, {'account_id': 5652, 'date': '2013-06-13 20:33:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

There are a bunch of cases like the one inline, where it's not clear if a method is being run for its return value or its side effect, and you remove the return value.  So if the method was run for its return value, we now have useless code, and no longer have a pyflakes warning to help us find it.  But if it's run for a side effect, the change is good.  (And the function shouldn't have had a return value since having both a return value and a side effect leads to this kind of confusion.)

So, once again, this is too big to review, because it's not obvious which case each removal falls into.

Can you do just the totally obviously correct ones?  Then we can go back and look at the others."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-21 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-21 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-13 17:08:22.000000000', 'message': 'Remove trivial cases of unused variables (2)

Kill some of the variables marked as unused by flakes8. This should
allow to enable F841 check in the future.
Only trivial cases with no function calls and obviously pure functions
(like datetime.now(), or len()) are cleaned up here.

Part 2, split to reduce conflicts.

Change-Id: I393b9f63b622afd5cc1edb4f322a2d94cd3f1660
'}]
commit_message:
Remove trivial cases of unused variables (2)

Kill some of the variables marked as unused by flakes8. This should
allow to enable F841 check in the future.
Only trivial cases with no function calls and obviously pure functions
(like datetime.now(), or len()) are cleaned up here.

Part 2, split to reduce conflicts.

Change-Id: I393b9f63b622afd5cc1edb4f322a2d94cd3f1660

[{'created': '2013-06-12 21:08:31.000000000', 'message': "Have reviewed each line of code generating log entries and have removed any
password and token information that were previouly logged (that are now
replaced by a '********' sequence).

Note that Django's error report filtering mechanisms are not used here:
they are to coarse and tend to hide too much useful information (esp. non
sensitive information).

Change-Id: I7ec900e859ffd0c0baaae2001ef7362f42e3d199
"}]
commit_message:
Have reviewed each line of code generating log entries and have removed any
password and token information that were previouly logged (that are now
replaced by a '********' sequence).

Note that Django's error report filtering mechanisms are not used here:
they are to coarse and tend to hide too much useful information (esp. non
sensitive information).

Change-Id: I7ec900e859ffd0c0baaae2001ef7362f42e3d199

commit_message:
Proxy affinity for writing.

* Implementation get_local_nodes function for collecting local nodes
  equal by number of replicas.
* Get_nodes was replacement by get_local_nodes with parameter regions
  in some places of code.
* Using configurable iter_nodes for some requests according to proxy
  affinity implementation.
* Add header 'x-auto-create-on-handoff' for PUT and DELETE at handoffs
  nodes.

Change-Id: I4a0b4befe348cc76292c11b46c9fb5200c61ee00
Implements: blueprint proxy-affinity-writes
Implements: blueprint multi-region

commit_message:
Client side of shares service in Cinder.

Introduced share-related operations:
    share-access-list   Show access list for share.
    share-allow         Allow access to the share.
    share-create        Creates new NAS storage (NFS or CIFS).
    share-delete        Deletes NAS storage.
    share-deny          Deny access to a share.
    share-list          List all NAS shares.
    share-show          Show details about a NAS share.
    share-snapshot-create   Create snapshot of share.
    share-snapshot-delete   Delete snapshot of share.
    share-snapshot-list     List all snapshots.
    share-snapshot-show     Show details of a snapshot.

Implements blueprint file-shares-service

Change-Id: I6366cbe7fe2b1e521a08c0a88dd27db5465aedff

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-06 23:58:44.000000000', 'message': 'Improve access to DB API.

Previously, DB API access was done by getting a reference to the
singleton via db.api.get_instance(). This style of access works well
within other singletons, but does not afford a more procedural
database access style, for instance in the unified object model's
"save" and "refresh" methods.

This patch adds a 'db.handle' alias and updates various classes to use
that. It also fixes the SSH driver, which was unnecessarily making a
database call in _get_nodes_mac_addresses.

Change-Id: Ic1eec69c6268d966b0c9ebcb41e8531addb1977d
'}]
commit_message:
Improve access to DB API.

Previously, DB API access was done by getting a reference to the
singleton via db.api.get_instance(). This style of access works well
within other singletons, but does not afford a more procedural
database access style, for instance in the unified object model's
"save" and "refresh" methods.

This patch adds a 'db.handle' alias and updates various classes to use
that. It also fixes the SSH driver, which was unnecessarily making a
database call in _get_nodes_mac_addresses.

Change-Id: Ic1eec69c6268d966b0c9ebcb41e8531addb1977d

commit_message:
Make sure instance_type has extra_specs

Make sure that when scheduling, the instance_type used in filters
contains the 'extra_specs'.  This is a bit ugly, but will get cleaned up
with objects.

Fixes bug 1192331

Change-Id: I3614f3a858840c9561b4e618fc30f3d3ae5ac689

commit_message:
Clean up failed image transfers in instance spawn

Boot one instance with powervm driver, will transfer the image
file to host. Need clean up failed image transfers that may occur
during instance spawn.

Fixes bug #1173017
(cherry picked from commit 68cc1cd511298208dde59878bfbef474a3625c9f)

Change-Id: Id06fa84bee63adc4af96a339526d75540978263f

Seems okay, I guess.

I was going to complain about not being able to simply run "tox" anymore, but the only place I can do that right now is on my Oneiric SAIO, and Oneiric is dead now, so I guess that's irrelevant.

It strikes me as odd that we have an environment where the tests are expected to fail, but it's not the end of the world.'}, {'account_id': 917, 'date': '2013-06-12 15:06:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I'm fine with this.  It is going to take a *long* time for python 3 support, but things like this are the first tiny steps."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-06-21 00:54:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Alright, so it turns out that if you run "tox -e py26,py27,pep8", then you get the same behavior as before, so this is fine.

commit_message:
python3: Introduce py33 to tox.ini

Introduce py33 to tox.ini to make testing with
python3 easier.

Change-Id: Id5c76d58551af4671f30ace85bdbbf5803a58368
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
NetApp unified driver implementation.

NetApp has growing number of multiple drivers depending on storage families
and technologies. NetApp unified driver simplifies configuration
and provides single entry point for all storage technologies/drivers.
It provides new mechanism to support multiple NetApp technologies
and block drivers related to them. Deprecated 7mode dfm and c mode
webservice based drivers.

blueprint netapp-unified-driver

Change-Id: Ife3cb12ef2256e0124c9a02a968c20a580b5df93

commit_message:
Fix BaseException.message DeprecationWarning

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/32154/ introduces a deprecated
TypeError.message reference, which won't work in python3 and
causes a DeprecationWarning to be output on >= python 2.6

Change-Id: Ibd11d4ad6b82e96ede8f38fe76112bd71e98c5c9

[{'created': '2013-06-19 06:09:34.000000000', 'message': "Remove the unused plugins framework

This framework was merged a year ago and AFAICT hasn't seen use beyond
the two initial wikimedia extensions.

The framework basically allows a way for a single plugin to register API
extensions and notification hooks. Both of these can be done by directly
using config opts like osapi_compute_extension and notification_driver
so this framework really only helps if we expected to (and wanted to)
lots of these plugins in the wild.

Change-Id: I09a11f9931ee0436a56e8b0d925683b54f73b104
"}, {'created': '2013-06-19 07:52:08.000000000', 'message': "Remove the unused plugins framework

The framework basically allows a way for a single plugin to register API

This framework was merged a year ago and AFAICT hasn't seen use beyond
the two initial wikimedia extensions.

The framework basically allows a way for a single plugin to register API
extensions and notification drivers. Both of these can be done by
directly using config opts like osapi_compute_extension and
notification_driver so this framework really only helps if we expected

Change-Id: I09a11f9931ee0436a56e8b0d925683b54f73b104
"}]
commit_message:
Remove the unused plugins framework

This framework was merged a year ago and AFAICT hasn't seen use beyond
the two initial wikimedia extensions.

The framework basically allows a way for a single plugin to register API
extensions and notification drivers. Both of these can be done by
directly using config opts like osapi_compute_extension and
notification_driver so this framework really only helps if we expected
to (and wanted to) lots of these plugins in the wild.

Change-Id: I09a11f9931ee0436a56e8b0d925683b54f73b104

[{'created': '2013-06-18 01:39:11.000000000', 'message': "Add err_msg param to baremetal_deploy_helper.

Updates the baremetal-deploy-helper so that we look for an
option 'e' POST parameter which contains an optional error
message string from the agent.

This works with the associated DIB branch here:
  http://review.openstack.org/#/c/33341/

And is also fully backwards compatible with existing agent scripts
which do not send the 'e' parameter.

Change-Id: I9a5914e719c2db6d2ae6d002cd386a0e48fda18d
"}]
commit_message:
Add err_msg param to baremetal_deploy_helper.

Updates the baremetal-deploy-helper so that we look for an
option 'e' POST parameter which contains an optional error
message string from the agent.

This works with the associated DIB branch here:
  http://review.openstack.org/#/c/33341/

And is also fully backwards compatible with existing agent scripts
which do not send the 'e' parameter.

Change-Id: I9a5914e719c2db6d2ae6d002cd386a0e48fda18d

commit_message:
Fix a race where a soft deleted instance might be removed by mistake

When a soft deleted instance is restored there is a tiny risk that it
might be deleted if the reclaim periodic task runs at the same time.
This happens because the restore operation sets deleted_at to None
which makes the reclaim job think it is ok to delete the instance.

This can be resolved by restricting reclaims to only those instances
whose task_state is None.

Resolves bug 1186243.

Change-Id: Ia138e2d504b7482c46900583f019a32c70513245

[{'created': '2013-06-13 05:22:01.000000000', 'message': 'Port certificates API to v3 Part 1

This changeset only copies the v2 files (implementation and test)
into the appropriate v3 directories unchanged. The copy as-is
will not be loaded by either the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The
second changeset will then make the changes required for it to
work as a v3 extension.

This is being done in order to make reviewing of extension porting
easier as gerrit will display only what is actually changed for v3
rather than entirely new files

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: Ibdb3b444432fa707786e6bb43aaba61d2a3fc89f
'}]
commit_message:
Port certificates API to v3 Part 1

This changeset only copies the v2 files (implementation and test)
into the appropriate v3 directories unchanged. The copy as-is
will not be loaded by either the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The
second changeset will then make the changes required for it to
work as a v3 extension.

This is being done in order to make reviewing of extension porting
easier as gerrit will display only what is actually changed for v3
rather than entirely new files

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: Ibdb3b444432fa707786e6bb43aaba61d2a3fc89f

commit_message:
cinder.backup: Replace 'locals()' with explicit values

Help bring source code into compliance with the Cinder Style Commandments:
https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/HACKING.rst

This change covers all affected source in the cinder backup module, i.e.
cinder/backup/*.py and subdirectories.

Partially fixes: bug #1190748

Change-Id: I3e0f3806030f1813d055135f15e64b5a719970ed

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-20 01:52:26.000000000', 'message': "python3: Fix traceback while running tests

The testsuite is full of the following:

TypeError: 'dict_keys' object does not support indexing

This is due to the fact in python3 dict methods dict.keys(),
dict.items() and dict.values() return “views” instead of lists.

Change-Id: Ifa5383e6485fdbabf363fd1442877b2452346c1c
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
"}]
commit_message:
python3: Fix traceback while running tests

The testsuite is full of the following:

TypeError: 'dict_keys' object does not support indexing

This is due to the fact in python3 dict methods dict.keys(),
dict.items() and dict.values() return “views” instead of lists.

Change-Id: Ifa5383e6485fdbabf363fd1442877b2452346c1c
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-06-20 08:50:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Ick.

This is a gigantic hack, because the real problem is that stats should be coming from Ceilometer, not from cfn-push-stats connecting to Heat, and therefore there should really be no reference to the WatchRule from the Instance at all.

It seems like the best we can do for now, but let's remove it again as soon as we integrate with Ceilometer."}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2013-06-20 11:18:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I don't disagree that it is a bit hacky. And even if we use
in-instance monitoring we will not have to reference the alarm, but both the instance and alarm will need to reference something in common (essentially a tag - could be the autoscale group name). which should break this circular ref."}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-06-20 23:53:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This change didn't actually fix my problem, I'm still getting None for the watch ref"}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2013-06-21 00:27:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Abandoned

didn't fix the problem:("}]

- early resolve FnGetRefId()'s in resolve_static_data() for known special cases

commit_message:
Special-case resources that return just a name from FnGetRefId

- remove strict_depenency mechanism
- early resolve FnGetRefId()'s in resolve_static_data() for known special cases

bug 1192814

Change-Id: Icea48b6cbe33e6bdc081317b7ea27ade9ba1eecb

commit_message:
Add conf file generator.

Add oslo generator.py and generate_sample.sh similar to nova.
These files provide generator functionality for creating a conf file.

Fixes: bug #1191032
Change-Id: I5a239e41f822e2f51c95d7a44e8d62c38c62c8ac

commit_message:
Fix broken compute tests

This change add 2 require_relative's for spec_helper as well as stubs
out the system call to grub2-set-default in the libvirt test for
opensuse.

Change-Id: Idcfee4fd279ebd503438f59f885b77fb2a328647

Hi, Carl, Dhcp agent will add default gateway '169.254.0.1' when enable_metadata_network = True. This patch will override that gateway. 

Please reference 'quantum/agent/dhcp_agent.py:585'

This add by this commit:

commit 24c77966b6449257c2bfa87419aafc3bb5f3c287
Author: Salvatore Orlando <salv.orlando@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Feb 13 16:46:43 2013 -0800

    Metadata support for NVP plugin

Looks like used by NVP plugin, hope Salvatore or other people familar with NVP plugin can come in have look at this."}, {'account_id': 6524, 'date': '2013-06-20 23:39:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(1 inline comment)

gongysh, thank you for your review.  I hope that I explained myself clearly in my reply.'}, {'account_id': 7448, 'date': '2013-06-20 23:39:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Alex, you raise a very good point.  The commit you referenced appears to be adding a gateway so that the dhcp namespace cat route packets back to the VMs on the metadata subnet.

A way to reconcile this is to set the route to the metadata subnet using the subnet cidr rather than "default."  I could offer to make that change.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-20 23:39:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Works for me

Hi,
I understand the need for the patch. In the file quantum/quantum/agent/dhcp_agent.py, there is a class DeviceManager. This has a method setup. I think that these changes should be added there.
That is where the interface is created.
Thanks
Gary"}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-06-20 23:39:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

you said 'the VMs that booted came up configured with an ip on the first subnet and the gateway too'.

It does not mean the gateway is realized. In general, the subnet gateway is quantum router's internal interface address. To access outside (upstream name resolution), we need set the router's gateway interface too. So I think to access the upstream name resolution in your patch's way, we need a fully-equipped quantum router, right?

why do u need a upstream name resolution? to resolve the VM's name with the floating ip? It seems we need a spec first."}, {'account_id': 7448, 'date': '2013-06-20 23:39:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Make it aware of isolated metadata enabled networks.  Since a gateway is already added in this case, we don't want this code to attempt adding another one.

Also, reformatted the code that checks conditions in which the network or subnet doesn't qualify for providing the default gateway."}, {'account_id': 7448, 'date': '2013-06-20 23:39:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-20 23:39:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Works for me

commit_message:
Adds default route to DHCP namespace for upstream name resolution.

Any time the DHCP server is updated this code will maintain a default
route in the DHCP namespace using the gateway_ip attribute of the
first DHCP-enabled IPV4 subnet in the list of subnets where gateway_ip
is not None.  This strategy uses the same gateway ip that the DHCP
server hands to the VMs on the network.

Change-Id: I0807550a848e1b610c7775d215643ad9c83629ed
Fixes: Bug #1181378

commit_message:
Disable vnc on Power Systems

Power systems don't have graphics adapters, so we can't simulate a VNC
console. This patch removes that from the default nova configuration
if the system architecture is ppc64.

Change-Id: I129d180b712115e5c275241740d34805fea23e8b

commit_message:
add create_image_from_server to base class for auto cleanup

this test's cleanup logic was fragile enough that it caused additional
breaks when it fell over, leaving resources around. Create a
create_image_from_server as an equiv of create_server to ensure
that images are auto cleaned up at the end of the run, or if we
fail.

Added logging for exception if found during clear_images

Added logging if we failed in setupClass

Fixes bug #1168586

Change-Id: I1cbd904a71eb81926195c3e7894003fe5016b12e

commit_message:
Move identity ldap backend from directory to file

The LDAP  backend for identity was in a subdirectory as opposed to a file
due to a clash between the name of the local package and the standard python package
both being called ldap.
This change makes the ldap backend look like the other backend.
The mechanism that fixes it is:

from __future__ import absolute_import

Change-Id: Id9ee518238ae22e5128351094eb3764a831cc083

commit_message:
Sync Qpid RPC fix from Oslo

A change had to be made in the Havana Qpid implementation that is
not entirely backwards compatible.  This change allows Grizzly to
receive messages in the new format.

Backport of change for bug 1175808

Change-Id: I6ab63c3fccf562aeeb793e09f057c66bc109ef41

commit_message:
SSH driver doesn't need to query database.

Don't fetch the nodes' ports from the database inside
ssh._get_nodes_mac_addresses() when we already have that
information in the NodeManager.

commit_message:
Add support for GET /v1/nodes to return a list.

Adds the db/api and db/sqlalchemy/api methods,
and the 'get' method in the API service.

Partially implements bp:node-api-actions

Change-Id: I214687c19150e65183f663d99f165d7fdea9915f

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-14 16:01:15.000000000', 'message': 'Add object support to API service.

The previous api/controllers/v1.py code was an early straw-man that
directly represented db/sqlalchemy/models.py data structures as a
proof-of-concept for the API service.

This replaces that by using the versioned object models which were
recently ported from Nova, wrapping them in an API class to allow for
type checking and versioning.

This patch also removes other methods which were part of that early
proof-of-concept, and which will be implemented according to the v1 API
spec in future patches.

It also removes the unused api/models/__init__.py and db/models.py
files.

Change-Id: I2580d863b383e12628821c9156195c00806beebd

commit_message:
Add object support to API service.

The previous api/controllers/v1.py code was an early straw-man that
directly represented db/sqlalchemy/models.py data structures as a
proof-of-concept for the API service.

This replaces that by using the versioned object models which were
recently ported from Nova, wrapping them in an API class to allow for
type checking and versioning.

This patch also removes other methods which were part of that early
proof-of-concept, and which will be implemented according to the v1 API
spec in future patches.

It also removes the unused api/models/__init__.py and db/models.py
files.

Partially implements bp:api-v1-impl

Change-Id: I2580d863b383e12628821c9156195c00806beebd

commit_message:
Add troubleshoot to baremetal PXE template.

We recently added an optional troubleshoot parameter to
diskimage_builder which defaults to 0 (false).

This commit adds the option to the Nova pxe_config.template
so it will be easier for people to find should they need to
enable troubleshooting mode.

Change-Id: I24cea1bb621b267a79fb170ace749fae14d06c30

[{'created': '2013-06-20 13:48:21.000000000', 'message': "Retry the sfdisk command up to 3 times.

Updates the nova baremetal-deploy-helper so that we retry
the fdisk command up to 3 times.

Previously the command would sometimes intermittently fail with
'Device or resource busy' errors. There doesn't seem to be a good way
to check/verify this other than to retry.

Fixes LP Bug #1191084.

Change-Id: I18be73cba9c5bf5a4f9cf229dedc4494666c9b35
"}]
commit_message:
Retry the sfdisk command up to 3 times.

Updates the nova baremetal-deploy-helper so that we retry
the fdisk command up to 3 times.

Previously the command would sometimes intermittently fail with
'Device or resource busy' errors. There doesn't seem to be a good way
to check/verify this other than to retry.

Fixes LP Bug #1191084.

Change-Id: I18be73cba9c5bf5a4f9cf229dedc4494666c9b35

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-20 14:54:56.000000000', 'message': "Add err_msg param to baremetal_deploy_helper.

Updates the baremetal-deploy-helper so that we look for an
option 'e' POST parameter which contains an optional error
message string from the agent.

This works with the associated DIB branch here:
  http://review.openstack.org/#/c/33341/

And is also fully backwards compatible with existing agent scripts
which do not send the 'e' parameter.

Change-Id: I9e6766560a8d8bf0d33059fc2547cbb8d2f861f6
"}]
commit_message:
Add err_msg param to baremetal_deploy_helper.

Updates the baremetal-deploy-helper so that we look for an
option 'e' POST parameter which contains an optional error
message string from the agent.

This works with the associated DIB branch here:
  http://review.openstack.org/#/c/33341/

And is also fully backwards compatible with existing agent scripts
which do not send the 'e' parameter.

Change-Id: I9e6766560a8d8bf0d33059fc2547cbb8d2f861f6

commit_message:
Updated API Spec for new Drivers

Updates the API specification to match the new
driver definitions.

Renamed management configuration to driver
configuration, and removed control and deployment
sections.

Change-Id: I561d72e935b12c2810c9a0835fe36028e88a86d9

commit_message:
Change memcache config entry name in Keystone to be consistent with Oslo

Currently, Keystone-Client is using 'memcache_servers' config option to store
the memcache server info, while in OSLO project, it is using 'memcached_servers'
to config the same option. It is better to change keystone-client's
'memcache_servers' to 'memcached_servers' to keep consistent between these two
projects.

Change-Id: I93ca0aa368f95a3ccf6de6984262057e61f75ffe
Fixes: Bug 1172793

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-08 11:27:59.000000000', 'message': 'The sql libraries does not necessary for tox -epep8

Adding any exact sql implementation to the requirement,
makes tempest deployment dependent.
The sqlalchemy supports both mysql,postgresql and sqlite.

The python modules requires C headers to be installed to be installed
 to a clean virtual environment anyway.

tox -efull is allowed to use the deployed sql back-end python packages.

Change-Id: Iec5066a30b51fb4c91465a23606ad5cd973bc40c
'}, {'created': '2013-06-16 05:12:54.000000000', 'message': 'Remove TODO note

Both postgresql and mysql headers are necessary for certain tox jobs,
but both installed by devstack now.

It was an issue in the past, but it was solved.
We was not able to combine both tools/pip-requires and tools/test-requires.

Change-Id: Iec5066a30b51fb4c91465a23606ad5cd973bc40c
'}, {'created': '2013-06-16 05:27:04.000000000', 'message': 'Remove TODO note

Both postgresql and mysql headers are necessary for certain tox jobs,
but both installed by when it is necerray. (pep8 job in a venv)

It was an issue in the past, but it was solved.
We was not able to combine both tools/pip-requires and tools/test-requires.

The pep8 jobs was done by a shell script, the shell script is removed.
tox aims to be the single entry point for all gate jobs.

Change-Id: Iec5066a30b51fb4c91465a23606ad5cd973bc40c
'}]
commit_message:
Remove TODO note

Both postgresql and mysql headers are necessary for certain tox jobs,
but both installed by when it is necerray. (pep8 job in a venv)

It was an issue in the past, but it was solved.
We was not able to combine both tools/pip-requires and tools/test-requires.

The pep8 jobs was done by a shell script, the shell script is removed.
tox aims to be the single entry point for all gate jobs.

Change-Id: Iec5066a30b51fb4c91465a23606ad5cd973bc40c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-18 17:02:09.000000000', 'message': 'Remove db session hack from conductor's vol_usage_update()

Commit 3cf4cb2534c387f287f118d4185d54b1435d3bc0 made the
vol_usage_update() in conductor hack around a stale sqlalchemy
object issue by keeping session active in the current context
until the notification was completed. This layering violation
led to some "creative" tests to try to verify this behavior.

This removes that and refreshes the object before letting it
out of the db/api layer so that all the attributes are present,
thus avoiding the dynamic load during notification.

Change-Id: Ia6ef5cb7f462ff72d170f3af33f2d020ee4d3e3c
'}, {'created': '2013-06-19 00:39:19.000000000', 'message': 'Remove db session hack from conductor's vol_usage_update()

Change-Id: Ia6ef5cb7f462ff72d170f3af33f2d020ee4d3e3c

commit_message:
Remove db session hack from conductor's vol_usage_update()

Commit 3cf4cb2534c387f287f118d4185d54b1435d3bc0 made the
vol_usage_update() in conductor hack around a stale sqlalchemy
object issue by keeping session active in the current context
until the notification was completed. This layering violation
led to some "creative" tests to try to verify this behavior.

This removes that and refreshes the object before letting it
out of the db/api layer so that all the attributes are present,
thus avoiding the dynamic load during notification.

Change-Id: Ia6ef5cb7f462ff72d170f3af33f2d020ee4d3e3c

commit_message:
Remove a layer of nesting in _poll_unconfirmed_resizes()

This simply changes the logic atop _poll_unconfirmed_resizes()
and de-indents everything that was nested underneath by four
spaces. It makes it much easier to work on without the useless
extra level of nesting.

Change-Id: I0d65fe2d1fc2649e0527ecbed1e6682b3da52b2b

commit_message:
Use InstanceList for _heal_instance_info_cache()

This makes _heal_instance_info_cache() use InstanceList for the
all-by-host query.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: I93872a35ff249bbeb7d02bfe54a7d83676aa447a

commit_message:
Remove straggling use of all-kwarg object methods

This removes one remaining vestige of the days of yore when
nova developers were forced to always use kwargs on object
methods out of fear, lest it be used over RPC.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: Ieba76efc2f5daed08e4bde9096c0e178f1f44466

commit_message:
Add _create_volume to ThinLVMVolumeDriver

Previously, _create_volume from LVMISCSIDriver would be called
when the volume manager calls create_volume_from_snapshot.

Fixes bug: 1192601

Change-Id: I5cca287e8204c4647a5f09df961d9a76d0b38c42

Now we have settings to hint if the agent is present or not,
and by default we do not check for the agent,
if the agent is not responding to our calls for its version,
we can fail the build.

In environments that need the agent to inject the networking,
you really want the agent to fail if it is not present.
If the agent did not inject the networking, the server will
have no networking.

fixes bug 1188540

commit_message:
xenapi: revisit error handling around calls to agent

Now we have settings to hint if the agent is present or not,
and by default we do not check for the agent,
if the agent is not responding to our calls for its version,
we can fail the build.

In environments that need the agent to inject the networking,
you really want the agent to fail if it is not present.
If the agent did not inject the networking, the server will
have no networking.

However, we can still leave the agent upgrade to silently
fail, as the agent should be backwards compatible.

fixes bug 1188540

Change-Id: I8acdabd8d2bd24b088dad3cd4abec300d0ada3fb

The actually glance executable is not installed as a part
of the python-glance package, it is installed in the
python-glanceclient pakcage.

Going through the RDO packages, I do not even see a package
called python-glance.

Change-Id: I35c71fc5da595a695b10cb2ecc5ad27f5131bac8
'}]
commit_message:
glance::client was not installing the correct package

The actually glance executable is not installed as a part
of the python-glance package, it is installed in the
python-glanceclient pakcage.

Going through the RDO packages, I do not even see a package
called python-glance.

Change-Id: I35c71fc5da595a695b10cb2ecc5ad27f5131bac8

commit_message:
Adding fixed_ip in create.end notification

Sending the network information for an instance in the create.end notification.

Fixes bug 1185076

Change-Id: Iabe088ed23736d7b1ee97624761445023aab22c2

and conf file, since it is confusing and actually other
authentication methods are not supported.

Fixes: bug #1180972

commit_message:
Remove basic_auth strategy

The auth strategy selection is removed
since it is confusing and other authentication
methods are not supported.

Re-commit the files, because the previous update is not correct.

Implements: remove basic_auth strategy
Fixes: bug #1180972
Change-Id: I498be0b1e3eeea397e1f164caffe7cc88be0ceda

commit_message:
Fix XML security group rule client.

The client ignored cidr and group_id.
It also did not handle None values for
several of the parameters.
Fixed both, refactored the rule
creation method.

Fixes: bug #1191856
Change-Id: I0aa28bc50e9991d0381f0b0d7e3edb05f8e90591

[{'created': '2013-06-19 20:44:57.000000000', 'message': 'Add posargs to tox coverage job.

This commit adds the posargs field to the tempest_coverage report
command on the tox coverage job. This will allow us to pass in
arguments to the report command which will be useful for the
periodic coverage runs so we can specify the output directory.

Change-Id: I89c9c8da7fbe5f73600a8e84557dbf325c341afc
'}]
commit_message:
Add posargs to tox coverage job.

This commit adds the posargs field to the tempest_coverage report
command on the tox coverage job. This will allow us to pass in
arguments to the report command which will be useful for the
periodic coverage runs so we can specify the output directory.

Change-Id: I89c9c8da7fbe5f73600a8e84557dbf325c341afc

commit_message:
Fix and enable H303 and F403  No wildcard (*) import.

F403 is related the message is:
F403 'from bla import *' used; unable to detect undefined names

Change-Id: I486c0b2fc15a616e3fdf1e7e2eaeae1e45075537

subject: Add max_header_size to swift.conf-sample and relative UT
messages:
[{'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-06-07 18:26:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-07 19:17:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

"}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-06-07 20:01:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Do not merge

MAX_HEADER_SIZE is the maximum length of any *one* HTTP header, not the maximum length of all the headers combined.'}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-06-08 02:00:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

sam, look like origin codes:

MAX_META_VALUE_LENGTH it used to check the value of meta header

MAX_META_NAME_LENGTH is used to check the key of meta header

MAX_META_OVERALL_LENGTH is used to check the sum of above two

MAX_HEADER_SIZE is used as same as MAX_META_VALUE_LENGTH

and default value of MAX_HEADER_SIZE is 8096, which looks like a common limit of request header size, not one header line. But the related bad request has body as "header line too long"

I think there must be something wrong about this MAX_HEADER_SIZE, usage or naming or default value'}, {'account_id': 2649, 'date': '2013-06-09 06:26:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Kun, I think Samuel is right.
The local variable of meta_size in the origin code is do the same thing as total_size your added code.
So MAX_META_OVERALL_SIZE is used to limit the total size of all headers, just like the response message 
said "Total metadata too large".
However, I also agree your concern of the default values. it doesn't make sense to limit one header to
 8192 but limit overall header length to 4096. So I suggest to exchange the two default values.

MAX_META_OVERALL_SIZE = constraints_conf_int('max_meta_overall_size', 8192)
MAX_HEADER_SIZE = constraints_conf_int('max_header_size', 4096)'}, {'account_id': 2649, 'date': '2013-06-09 06:50:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I take back my comment to exchange default value.
The MAX_HEADER_SIZE is not only to limit headers of user metadata, but also to limit other headers in request.
It could be possibly larger than MAX_META_OVERALL_SIZE.
Correct me if I'm wrong. :-)"}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-06-09 07:03:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Agreed with your understanding of MAX_META_OVERALL_SIZE

But the origin codes use MAX_HEADER_SIZE and MAX_META_VALUE_LENGTH in same way, which has different default value 4096 and 256.

Maybe the name of variables looks like they are used to limit header or meta, but in check_meta what is checked is req.headers which contains meta and content-type and so on.

MAX_HEADER_SIZE may be used like MAX_META_OVERALL_SIZE, but never same. For meta, we test the length of "key"+"value", and for header, we test the length of "x-object-meta-key: value".

So I think there should be some improvement here.'}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-06-09 07:27:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

BTW, hua, this MAX_HEADER_SIZE  is added in this patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/22895/

I would ask david about is correct usage but I didn't find his irc id..."}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-06-11 14:04:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

So MAX_HEADER_SIZE is the maximum any single header can be, regardless of whether it's a meta header or just some other header. It has nothing to do with the overall size of all the headers combined. It even says in its comment "Max size of any header". There is no setting for the max size of all headers combined. That'd be a new MAX_HEADERS_SIZE I guess?'}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-06-11 14:45:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

gholt

what do you think give default size 1024 to MAX_HEADER_SIZE

and rename META_OVERALL_SIZE to  MAX_HEADERS_SIZE (in check_meta, this is no difference from meta header and normal header, so I think that we could use it to config overall headers)'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-06-11 15:41:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Well, let's start with: What are you trying to accomplish? Is there something you're trying fix? Some bug you're encountering?

There is a difference between non-meta headers and meta headers in check_metadata. Everything before "if not key.lower().startswith(prefix):" is for both, everything after is for meta headers only.

Why do you want to restrict each header to 1024 instead of the current 8192? Keystone tokens are really long (not sure if they exceed 1024 since I don't personally use Keystone, but I know they're really long).'}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-06-11 15:58:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

sorry, I miss the "if not key.lower().startswith(prefix):" line.

But I still feel the 8192 is werid. Many HTTP Serves give default headers limit 4096 ~ 8192, but we use it to limit one header line. It's possible to something about keystone. I'll take some time on it and reply later.'}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-06-13 06:51:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

gholt, sam, I have new evidences.

1. 8192 is from keystone PKI token, which has default token size 8192.

2. set 8192 for MAX_HEADER_SIZE seems as same as set unlimit to most of headers. Here PKI token is a very special case. so let's see what keystone developers did. https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/etc/keystone.conf.sample#L40

simply, they set 64 for common param value, and for the very special PKI token, use 8192 instead. their strategy keep both 64 and 8192 meaningful in my option"}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-06-14 03:21:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-14 03:36:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

[{'created': '2013-06-07 18:13:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fix usage of MAX_HEADER_SIZE

Sum the total length of key/value in request headers, and compare it to
MAX_HEADER_SIZE. If the total size is greate, return a bad request.

Also add new test cases in test_constraints. The new ones could check
whether user set some invalid configration.

Change-Id: I7bb21951d46050163c1b7bceac8d49302b9209f7
'}, {'created': '2013-06-07 18:26:00.000000000', 'message': 'Fix usage of MAX_HEADER_SIZE

Sum the total length of key/value in request headers, and compare it to
MAX_HEADER_SIZE. If the total size is greate, return a bad request.

Also add new test cases in test_constraints. The new ones could check
whether user set some invalid configration.

Change-Id: I7bb21951d46050163c1b7bceac8d49302b9209f7
'}, {'created': '2013-06-14 03:21:43.000000000', 'message': "Fix MAX_HEADER_SIZE and add MAX_TOKEN_SIZE

MAX_HEADER_SIZE's default size is 8192 because of Keystone PKI auth
token. But setting 8192 to all headers seems not meaningful for most of
other headers. This patch add MAX_TOKEN_SIZE to limit 'X-Auth-Token' and
use MAX_HEADER_SIZE(defualt 1024) to limit other common headers in a
reasonable size.

Also add new test cases in test_constraints. The new ones could check
whether user set some invalid configration.

Change-Id: I7bb21951d46050163c1b7bceac8d49302b9209f7
"}, {'created': '2013-06-18 17:14:03.000000000', 'message': "Add max_header_size to swift.conf-sample and relative UT

1. Add explanation of MAX_HEADER_SIZE into swift.conf-sample as same as
other settings in swift.conf. Especially point out the default size of
header line in eventlet is 8192 which is the main reason why we set 8192
for MAX_HEADER_SIZE in swift.

2. Add some unit tests to check valid settings in swift.conf. Test cases
in test_constraints use /etc/swift/swift.conf if exists, and if any
wrong settings are in it (MAX_META_VALE > MAX_META_OVERALL_SIZE), swift's
unit test must fail. These new unit tests is used in this case.

Change-Id: I7bb21951d46050163c1b7bceac8d49302b9209f7

commit_message:
Add max_header_size to swift.conf-sample and relative UT

1. Add explanation of MAX_HEADER_SIZE into swift.conf-sample as same as
other settings in swift.conf. Especially point out the default size of
header line in eventlet is 8192 which is the main reason why we set 8192
for MAX_HEADER_SIZE in swift.

2. Add some unit tests to check valid settings in swift.conf. Test cases
in test_constraints use /etc/swift/swift.conf if exists, and if any
wrong settings are in it (MAX_META_VALE > MAX_META_OVERALL_SIZE), swift's
unit test must fail. These new unit tests is used in this case.

Change-Id: I7bb21951d46050163c1b7bceac8d49302b9209f7

commit_message:
Fix IP spoofing filter blocking all packets.

Implement IP spoofing filter by adding yet another chain to iptables
with RETURN rule for each of IP addresses assigned to port and DROP
rule at the end of the chain.

Fixes: bug #1190613
Change-Id: I2e7a0f8dd4c3519c57d28e87a44735a3482624b1

Ian, I think the only reason why my patch wasn't merged is we do *not* want to import specifics from nose anymore.

testtools tries already to use the unittest2 exception for SKIPS so no need to try_import that ; the only thing we should change, after nose has got that, is a requirement for unittest2"}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2013-06-20 08:45:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Ian, I think the only reason why my patch wasn't merged is we do *not* want to import specifics from nose anymore.

Yep, I agree it's not a good solution; but it's only a temporary thing.  testtools is fixed, and this change incorporates the new version, and the nose change has a pull request on github.  So this is really just to let our CI jobs run on RHEL in the mean time until that's upstream & released.

> testtools tries already to use the unittest2 exception for SKIPS so no need to try_import that ; the only thing we should change, after nose has got that, is a requirement for unittest2

Yeah, testtools needs Robert's fix in 0.9.32, but everything is in-place to revert this.

I just noticed it failed pep tests, because I try importing unittest but never use it to see if we need the override.  Perhaps your method of checking the system version is better?  Or I could del it after; i can test that..."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-06-20 11:06:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

We can not put nose exceptions in, end of story. We are litterally days to weeks away from flipping to testr. I suggest a local patch to nose instead of this in your CI.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2013-06-20 12:08:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Abandoned

We'll take a different approach here"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-20 05:09:27.000000000', 'message': 'Work-around nose issue when skipping tests

As described in the comments, older versions of python (such as 2.6 on
RHEL) are not correctly skipping tests due to a mis-match of the
SkipTest exception between testtools and nose.  This is a work-around
while [1] is resolved.

This change pulls in a later version of testtools for the fix for [2].
It also creates a dependency on unittest2 which, as described in the
comments, is the fall-back SkipTest class to be used on python < 2.7

With this, I correctly see Quantum tests skipped when Quantum is
unavailable:

---
$ nosetests  tempest.api.compute.servers.test_attach_interfaces
SS
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 0 tests in 0.003s

OK (SKIP=2)
---

See [3]; Giulio Fidente did the work to diagnose this

[1] https://github.com/nose-devs/nose/pull/699
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/testtools/+bug/1190951
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/33056

Change-Id: I12d512d52dc6ac720775b3a43db654447a9eb1aa
Fixes: bug #1177608
'}]
commit_message:
Work-around nose issue when skipping tests

As described in the comments, older versions of python (such as 2.6 on
RHEL) are not correctly skipping tests due to a mis-match of the
SkipTest exception between testtools and nose.  This is a work-around
while [1] is resolved.

This change pulls in a later version of testtools for the fix for [2].
It also creates a dependency on unittest2 which, as described in the
comments, is the fall-back SkipTest class to be used on python < 2.7

With this, I correctly see Quantum tests skipped when Quantum is
unavailable:

---
$ nosetests  tempest.api.compute.servers.test_attach_interfaces
SS
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 0 tests in 0.003s

OK (SKIP=2)
---

See [3]; Giulio Fidente did the work to diagnose this

[1] https://github.com/nose-devs/nose/pull/699
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/testtools/+bug/1190951
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/33056

Change-Id: I12d512d52dc6ac720775b3a43db654447a9eb1aa
Fixes: bug #1177608

How does that fits with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/33057/ ?'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2013-06-17 11:19:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@jd_

Am I oversimplifying in thinking all that's required to reconcile the two patches is that these changes:

 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/33084/2/ceilometer/compute/instance.py

... move to:

 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/33057/2/ceilometer/compute/pollsters.py

In which case, one patch lands first, then the other is rebased before it can land. Alternatively one patch is rebased on the other before being re-proposed.

Or have I missed a more fundamental conflict between the patches?

Or is the question more along the lines of: how is the instance user metadata to be captured in the non-pollster (i.e. notification handler) case?

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-06-17 11:31:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Nah, sorry I was not more explicit.

The patched I pointed to is about capturing all metadata from events without filtering the metadata we publish. I was thinking that this applied to nova's pollster too, but I see it does not.

Though the question remains, what about just capturing everything so even a user can use them as a filter when accessing Ceilometer and reading its own samples?"}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2013-06-17 11:44:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@jd_

A-ha OK, got it.

So, when we discussed this on IRC last week, I thought the conclusion was that we should be selective about which user metadata to capture, to avoid the potential for bloat.

(As the default quota limiting the number of user metadata items allowed per instance is a hefty 128)

Is that no longer a concern?

If it, then the selectivity could be implemented for notifications also.

Cheers,
Eohgan'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-06-17 12:06:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

You're right, I was just thinking out loud, but I'm fine with it that way.

See inline comment for my -1."}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2013-06-17 14:11:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2013-06-17 14:18:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2013-06-17 14:34:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Capture instance metadata in reserved namespace.

The concept of a reserved namespace for instance metadata
is intended to support the Heat autoscaling use-case.

When spinning up new instances in a autoscaling group, Heat
will set some additional user metadata on the instances to
identify their group membership.

Previously, instance user metadata was not captured in the
metering store and thus could not be queried on.

Now the reserved namespace(s) are used to signal to the
compute agent that some user metadata should not be discarded.
This allows the statistics for a group of associated instances
to be aggregated in a single query.

Change-Id: I838db38bf2e01a0e5e4d76f3f401d7f41e1dff57

commit_message:
Using unicode() to handle image's properties

Replace str() to unicode() to allow nova-api work well with the fix I
did in glanceclient (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/29245/6).

Fixes: Bug #1180377

Change-Id: I6bfcaf6d69abcfe7c1d45eae28d77795a7443252
(cherry picked from commit 832a66cf0bd8f7ccb0878889174c1ce4da7f42f3)

commit_message:
Modify __clear_cache function

Clears cache after function is called.

The reload_config_files() function needs to clear cache after it is called.

Partially implements bp cfg-reload-config-files

Change-Id: If046719253bca4ca4eabd2a2abdaf09e44500099

[{'created': '2013-05-24 16:07:33.000000000', 'message': 'Sync oslo-incubator gettextutils

needed for supporting API message localization in Nova.

here's the better paste - http://paste.openstack.org/show/38304/"}, {'account_id': 7040, 'date': '2013-06-10 07:04:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Thanks for your comments. In general it's probably best to sync them all, but I also wanted to minimize changes for a specific fix. I'm happy to sync it all though."}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2013-06-10 09:24:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Comment re commit-message bug references

I also agree that in general we should just sync to a specific oslo-incubator version, and reference the SHA of the oslo version in the commit syncing into heat.

You can still add details of the specific fixes relevant to Heat which the oslo rebase-update pulls in, and reference the related bugs etc.

IMO this makes it much clearer what oslo version we're aligned with, although we might still sometime choose to sync individual fixes if needed late in the development cycle (close to release/milestone).

Since it's still early h2, I'd say just sync everything.

Note some testing will be required (not just unit tests!!) as sometimes we have to make changes due to non-backwards compatible changes in oslo API's."}, {'account_id': 7040, 'date': '2013-06-10 13:10:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-09 03:32:00.000000000', 'message': 'Update rpc/impl_qpid.py from oslo

The current qpid driver cannot serialize objects containing strings
longer than 65535 characters.  This just became a breaking issue when
the message to scheduler_run_instance went over that limit.  The fix has
been commited to oslo, so this just syncs it over to Nova.

Bug 1175808
Bug 1187595

Change-Id: Ic1de6b786a9d67b39d186e31a37049729d367464

Fixes: bug #1192176
Change-Id: Ifdd4aefa8ff38ac1ee72607d6ffd128ca315bf44
'}, {'created': '2013-06-19 11:20:39.000000000', 'message': 'Object client adds content-length if PUT is empty

Add content-length=0 header to a PUT request if the uploaded object is empty,
otherwise the server would repond with 411.

Fixes: bug #1192176
Change-Id: Ifdd4aefa8ff38ac1ee72607d6ffd128ca315bf44
'}]
commit_message:
Object client adds content-length if PUT is empty

Add content-length=0 header to a PUT request if the uploaded object is empty,
otherwise the server would repond with 411.

Fixes: bug #1192176
Change-Id: Ifdd4aefa8ff38ac1ee72607d6ffd128ca315bf44

Python3 enforces the distinction between byte
strings and text strings more rigorously than
python2. So use six.text_type where approiate
and six.string_types.

Change-Id: Iaab049fff97278d94fd7ab932a514949094a949a
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
'}]
commit_message:
python3: Fix traceback while running python3.

Python3 enforces the distinction between byte
strings and text strings more rigorously than
python2. So use six.text_type where approiate
and six.string_types.

Change-Id: Iaab049fff97278d94fd7ab932a514949094a949a
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Delete the temporary directory created by sources handler

Register a hook to delete the temporary directory created by sources
handler at program cfn-init exit.

Change-Id: I821195cf510d35f94b1e7656dacc0dfe308ceeb1
Fixes: bug #1191674

commit_message:
Make sure exceptions during policy checks are logged.

If the invocation of f bombs out, the policy check fails (i.e. returns
False), however it does not log the root cause, which makes very
difficult to understand why this is happening.

Fixes bug #1191948

Change-Id: Ic40053f3965b71199baf9fe3902e8ffc9745076f

commit_message:
Only display tenant resources in network topology when admin

Change how the JSON renders so that it checks for tenant IDs
but still allows shared and external networks to be shown
for each project, no longer directly accesses the python
clients instead uses the api class.

Change-Id: I1c4c97cf0bc6df3c13be2b1b97fe621817425c09
Fixes: bug #1151101

commit_message:
Use full path to dib-run-parts during firstboot.

Commit cc5ecb4e9cb29c45369cc07014c15202f4a5fd78 switched from using
run-parts in favor of dib-run-parts.

/usr/local/bin isn't part of PATH on Ubuntu causing
"/usr/sbin/dib-first-boot: line 8: dib-run-parts: command not found".

Change-Id: Ia7e401221add197edf880af82e0148f3ba7d2b9c

- http://logs.openstack.org/33056/3/check/gate-tempest-pep8/3718 : SUCCESS in 2m 43s

- http://logs.openstack.org/33056/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum-full/1846 : FAILURE in 53m 46s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2013-06-14 17:13:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

the day we move away from nose we'll have to update the test.py file anyway (which is the only place were we call nose resource explicitly) and by that time we will probably have more options to replace the exception with

meantime, given comment 11 at https://bugs.launchpad.net/tempest/+bug/1177608/comments/11 I don't see many other solutions yet I'd be happy to reimplement if someone can come up with a better idea"}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-06-14 20:41:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-06-15 10:32:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2013-06-15 12:51:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (2 inline comments)

replied to comments inline'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-06-16 09:39:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

So the issue is: if you run the tests on python 2.6 with nosetests, the skip exceptions from setUpClass will be considered as an ERROR, like any other exception.

The 'skip' in nose is a built-in plugin, which detects skip exception in different way on a different python version.  
As I remember because of language limitations, it cannot work in same way on py26.

This issues moderately manageable with other components,
but tempest+nose+testtools on py26 alone behaves incorrectly.

On py26 gate job tempest would fail.
Outside a managed env it is very annoying, to anbofy who runs tempest on py26.

I agree the commit message is not fully correct, but it is an issue, what somehow needs to be solved.

As I remember this issue is not a generic nose issue.
It is combination of different base class and py26 issue,
nose "backported" the setUpClasses from the future (py27) to (py26), but I have doubts about is any more simple solution exists.'}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-06-20 01:58:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I'm not sure why we're making this harder than it is: it's one small patch to nose, to improve it's compat; then depend on unittest2 (so you get setUpClass without nose on py2.6) and update to the latest testtools. Done."}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2013-06-20 02:05:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I agree; I have some time so will get a nose patch off today.  testtools with the fix is released, so it's just a unittest2 dependency after that"}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2013-06-20 07:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

so I'm abandoning this, let's see if nose is okay with unittest2"}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2013-06-20 07:06:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned'}]
