commit_message:
Fixes skip bug on py26

On py26 unittest.TestCase does not offer any SkipTest exception so
testtools.TestCase.skipException is not reporting failure correctly; we
replace that with the nose SkipTest class when running on versions < 2.7

Change-Id: I948350ae66b289e50092d8d0d9bd4cf30739ffed
Fixes: bug #1177608

commit_message:
Use default libvirt_vif_driver driver.

In Grizzly all the libvirt vif drivers were merged together.  Now
libvirt_vif_driver defaults to
  libvirt_vif_driver=nova.virt.libvirt.vif.LibvirtGenericVIFDriver
The only, non-deprecated driver.

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LibvirtVIFDrivers
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/libvirt-vif-driver

Fixes bug 1183557

Change-Id: I257931e086faef2a608e09a8b2facadc0699941a

commit_message:
Fix faulty 404 errors when requesting bad versions

The problem came down to the `_dispatch` method of the openstack
common wsgi router object. When a match was not found it returned
a webob 404 exception directly rather than allowing it to be
wrapped in a serializer.

The fix involved extending the `Router` object and reimplementing
the `_dispatch()` method to use the `Fault` object that serializes
exceptions.

Change-Id: I24a590f65ff655b25cfd7d84786df3055af701f1
Fixes: bug #1174960

[{'created': '2013-05-31 20:27:18.000000000', 'message': 'Rule based access control improvements

This change implements a number of proposed improvements
to the current rule based access control in Nova.  Changes
have been made to remove the require_admin_context decorator
in places where it overrides the rule defined in policy.json.
Changes have been made to allow command access to be defined
for individual commands in cases where a single rule currently
applies to multiple commands.  Error handling has been
improved to always return an HTTP 403 in cases where a rule
check fails.

Change-Id: Iec44413f72c905d43eb443620da012d948c1315c

in places where it overrides the rule defined in policy.json.
Changes have been made to allow command access to be defined
for individual commands in cases where a single rule currently
applies to multiple commands.  Error handling has been

check fails.

Change-Id: Iec44413f72c905d43eb443620da012d948c1315c

commit_message:
Rule based access control improvements

This change implements a number of proposed improvements
to the current rule based access control in Nova.  Changes
have been made to remove the require_admin_context decorator
in places where it overrides the rule defined in policy.json.
Changes have been made to allow command access to be defined
for individual commands in cases where a single rule currently
applies to multiple commands.  Error handling has been
improved to always return an HTTP 403 in cases where a rule
check fails.

Change-Id: Iec44413f72c905d43eb443620da012d948c1315c
Implements: blueprint rbac-improvements

subject: OVS plugin: enable tunneling if GRE is enabled
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-20 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me Build succeeded. - http://logs.openstack.org/28846/1/check/gate-puppet-quantum-puppet-unit-2.6/88 : SUCCESS in 00:00:30 - http://logs.openstack.org/28846/1/check/gate-puppet-quantum-puppet-unit-2.7/88 : SUCCESS in 00:00:36 - http://logs.openstack.org/28846/1/check/gate-puppet-quantum-puppet-unit-3.0/88 : SUCCESS in 00:00:31 - http://logs.openstack.org/28846/1/check/gate-puppet-quantum-puppet-unit-3.1/88 : SUCCESS in 00:00:28 '}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-20 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-20 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 2265, 'date': '2013-06-20 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-stdlib/blob/master/lib/puppet/parser/functions/ensure_resource.rb#L16'}, {'account_id': 2265, 'date': '2013-06-20 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: ah, gotcha, so on that node, you do not need the ports/bridges created, just that setting set. Can you check out ensure_resource from stdlib for this? It should only conditionally set the setting when it is not already set elsewhere (so that the agents can still be deployed on the same node as the plugin)'}, {'account_id': 2265, 'date': '2013-06-20 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: sorry for the slow response. I kept putting off this review b/c I knew it was going to take a little bit of time to sort through. I should start by saying, I'm not quantum expert, so I could easily be wrong. The specific issue that I have with the putting that configuration here, is that for my use case it will result in a duplicate resource definition b/c I am deploying both the ovs agents and plugins on the same system. Based on what I think I know about qauntum this seems appropriate for two reasons: our use-case for GRE is to setup a tunnel to our controller host so that we only need that node to have access to the outside world and the resources that setup the required ports and bridge are in the agents::ovs class. doesn't the agent service perform the actual of establishing the GRE tunnel?"}, {'account_id': 2463, 'date': '2013-06-20 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Restored Restoring change. As far as I am concerned this change is still valid.'}, {'account_id': 2463, 'date': '2013-06-20 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Must confess I've never used that before, would it be like 
    ensure_resource('quantum_plugin_ovs', {
      # TODO(ijw): do something with a virtualised node
      'OVS/enable_tunneling':   value => 'True';
      'OVS/tunnel_id_ranges':   value => $tunnel_id_ranges;
    })
"}, {'account_id': 2463, 'date': '2013-06-20 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Pinging this one. Any interested reviewers?'}, {'account_id': 2463, 'date': '2013-06-20 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Dan, the problem with the existing approach is that while you might have the *plugin* running on the API node (the same node that also runs quantum-server), the *plugin agent* may only be on the network node (where L3 and DHCP agents run) and compute nodes (where guests are being bridged into the tenant networks). So, you might have a node (the API node) where you have the plugin running, but no plugin agent. However, if we want to use GRE, we need to enable tunneling for both the plugin and the agent, as otherwise quantum-server will just refuse to start. And since on the API node we can't assume that an agent is running (it's not necessary; the API node doesn't need to communicate with neither the network or compute node), the plugin needs to set this by itself."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-20 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-20 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-20 06:03:03.000000000', 'message': 'OVS plugin: enable tunneling if GRE is enabled

The assumption that an plugin node will always have an agent installed
is wrong. In contrast, if the server loads the OVS plugin
configured for GRE, but without tunneling enabled, the API service
just dies.

Revert to always enabling tunneling when the user has selected GRE.

Change-Id: Ifb345ca942f06d7c9328546eab2f426c23829b1b
'}]
commit_message:
OVS plugin: enable tunneling if GRE is enabled

The assumption that an plugin node will always have an agent installed
is wrong. In contrast, if the server loads the OVS plugin
configured for GRE, but without tunneling enabled, the API service
just dies.

Revert to always enabling tunneling when the user has selected GRE.

Change-Id: Ifb345ca942f06d7c9328546eab2f426c23829b1b

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-19 23:37:26.000000000', 'message': "Modify check for volume-type-id to a get w/default

While implementing Fix for a previous bug to enable setting
volume type on a cloned volume and reading it's info we added
a vref['volume_type_id'], problem is that the _do_clone method
is shared for both clone and create from snapshot.

In the create from snapshot case however that key doesn't exist
in the vref (which is a snapshot object).

This change turns this into a key.get with a default return.

Fixes bug: 1192745

Change-Id: I1a6d38de614f54fcaa31ea7cc4250aacc85b0796
"}]
commit_message:
Modify check for volume-type-id to a get w/default

While implementing Fix for a previous bug to enable setting
volume type on a cloned volume and reading it's info we added
a vref['volume_type_id'], problem is that the _do_clone method
is shared for both clone and create from snapshot.

In the create from snapshot case however that key doesn't exist
in the vref (which is a snapshot object).

This change turns this into a key.get with a default return.

Fixes bug: 1192745

Change-Id: I1a6d38de614f54fcaa31ea7cc4250aacc85b0796

commit_message:
Don't perform retry_execute in certain cases.

Certain cases like "LVM not found" and "Insufficient space"
in LVM create/delete shouldn't be retried.

Change-Id: I1a0891f769d37dc858c70b07c838f9fc4111a76c

commit_message:
Remove more references to /var/log/nova.

These were recently removed from the nova element, not all references
were removed causing firstboot to fail with
chown: cannot access `/var/log/nova': No such file or directory

Change-Id: I5a02733d07a697c2d933b9407959b1679b115d12

[{'created': '2013-06-20 05:15:40.000000000', 'message': "Use dib-run-parts on dib-first-boot.

At least on RedHat the run-parts command is very precarious and doesn't
even check for the return code of the scripts it runs causing the
dib-first-boot to delete itself even when something went wrong with the
configuration of the first boot of the image. Using the dib-run-parts
instead will make the whole first boot routine to be more robust and
less platform dependent.

Change-Id: I0073fd52fc1fc8848ca9277a84603124215cdb6e
"}]
commit_message:
Use dib-run-parts on dib-first-boot.

At least on RedHat the run-parts command is very precarious and doesn't
even check for the return code of the scripts it runs causing the
dib-first-boot to delete itself even when something went wrong with the
configuration of the first boot of the image. Using the dib-run-parts
instead will make the whole first boot routine to be more robust and
less platform dependent.

Change-Id: I0073fd52fc1fc8848ca9277a84603124215cdb6e

commit_message:
Add tool to check db migration script

Tox checks the db migration scripts by getting latest upstream code,
then use the new tool to check the db migration scripts to make
sure no branch created.

Related to bug 1186113

Change-Id: I3a138daa35fac69571798c706700106649e7bd13

If the keystone team identifies it at something they understand bug can't fix right away, we can skip after that. commit_message:
Add old display name to update notification

Add old display name to payload of update notification when it is
changed, so the notification consumer could know the display name is
changed which is the same as task_state.
Fixes bug 1191612

Change-Id: I47b8ad8ffc2988212b59fb141e83b8110994b8da

Nit. The commit message has a typo, dependncies, and one extra-long line.

This creates a bit of a split-brain in the API. The BaseLdap class still takes the value of an rdn component as its id. Is this going to cause confusion in the future, where we wonder whether a given API requires a DN or a string that will be automatically converted to DN for us?'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-06-18 15:43:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-06-18 15:47:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

Had to revert the change in identity/core.py as, with recent changes to master, that was breaking in unexplained ways.  Really shouldn't be part of this patch anyway.

To address Rob's questions:  the split brain is due to the objects knowing how to manage their own id->dn mappings, but not for ids of other Classes.

I think further cleanup of the BaseLDAP code is called for.  Perhaps a change where all functions take in DNs instead of IDs is called for.

Fixed the commit message."}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-06-18 16:21:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Removing LDAP API Shim

The LDAP identity code had many circular dependecies between
data objects due to the need to look up DNs from ID.   This change
pulls the lookups into the driver layer, and modifies most of the
data objects to take DNs in as their parameters instead. Only objects
that know how to look up their own DNs from thei IDs will continue to
take IDs in, to support the "get" methods.

Change-Id: I0bac360650ccbf72c7ca8317997031420f66e4f3

commit_message:
Drop `bm_pxe_ips` table from baremetal database.

- added migration and tests
- removed model `BareMetalPxeIp`
- from nova/virt/baremetal/db/sqlalchemy/api.py removed functions
 `bm_pxe_ip_get_all`, `bm_pxe_ip_create`, `bm_pxe_ip_create_direct`,
 `bm_pxe_ip_destroy`, `bm_pxe_ip_destroy_by_address`, 'bm_pxe_ip_get`,
 `bm_pxe_ip_get_by_bm_node_id`, `bm_pxe_ip_associate`, 'bm_pxe_ip_disassociate`
- from nova/virt/baremetal/db/api.py removed functions
 `bm_node_associate_and_update`, `bm_pxe_ip_create`, `bm_pxe_ip_create_direct`,
 `bm_pxe_ip_destroy`, `bm_pxe_ip_destroy_by_address`, `bm_pxe_ip_get_all`,
 `bm_pxe_ip_get`, `bm_pxe_ip_get_by_bm_node_id, `bm_pxe_ip_associate`,
 `bm_pxe_ip_disassociate`
- from nova/tests/virt/baremetal/db/utils.py removed function `new_bm_pxe_ip`
- removed nova/tests/virt/baremetal/db/test_bm_pxe_ip.py
- modified `baremetal/volume_driver.py` - now we get `address` using
  nova db api

Fixes bug 1156745

Change-Id: I61f78d692da276694d79a7c1a8d45a466d124c70

subject: Remove usage of locals() for formatting from nova.scheduler.*
messages:
[{'account_id': 7740, 'date': '2013-06-19 16:38:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (3 inline comments)

I don't object to a merge but for a single-argument format string I prefer a format specifier that omits the mapping key and the argument to be supplied by itself.  
E.g.: 
    "%s" % s_arg 
instead of 
    "%(s_arg)s" % {'s_arg': s_arg}

See http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/devref/il8n.html for an example.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-19 17:01:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

[{'created': '2013-06-19 16:11:54.000000000', 'message': 'Remove usage of locals() for formatting from nova.scheduler.*

Using of locals() for formatting string is a nasty thing because:
1) It is not so clear as using explicit dicts
2) It could produce hidden errors during refactoring
3) Changing name of variable causes change in message
4) Creating a lot of unused variables

fixes bug #1171936

Change-Id: I7639631846a9145c3a18f2a704b71184ec781f45
'}, {'created': '2013-06-19 17:41:48.000000000', 'message': 'Remove usage of locals() for formatting from nova.scheduler.*

Using of locals() for formatting string is a nasty thing because:
1) It is not so clear as using explicit dicts
2) It could produce hidden errors during refactoring

commit_message:
Remove usage of locals() for formatting from nova.scheduler.*

Using of locals() for formatting string is a nasty thing because:
1) It is not so clear as using explicit dicts
2) It could produce hidden errors during refactoring
3) Changing name of variable causes change in message
4) Creating a lot of unused variables

fixes bug #1171936

Change-Id: I7639631846a9145c3a18f2a704b71184ec781f45

commit_message:
Converts scheduler.utils.build_request_spec return to json primitive

Other than 'instance', 'image' can also be a complex structure and
then it needs to be converted. See: nova.compute.rpcapi.prep_resize
as an example.

Change-Id: I54570dad3eae6ecc91a433af68263794c22e268d

commit_message:
Implement attribute schema for resources

Similar to properties, adds attribute_schema and attributes members to
Resources in order to facilitate document generation and template
provider stubs for resources.

Change-Id: Ie858fc71a91078e14af552d8cafe0f2448f5d2b8
Implements: blueprint attributes-schema

commit_message:
Switch deprecated rabbit_notifier to rpc_notifier

The 'nova.notifier.rabbit_notifier' is deprecated since the F release of
Openstack in favor of 'nova.openstack.common.notifier.rabbit_notifier'.
The latter being deprecated since the G release of Openstack in favor of
'nova.openstack.common.notifier.rpc_notifier'.

Change-Id: I4bd5819fd8e1fc7c75b20273418d821a04c4858e

commit_message:
Remove pool selection from "Add Monitor" page

Allow one to create a health monitor object without
any association. Add buttons "Add Health Monitor" and
"Delete Health Monitor" on pools table page.

fixes bug 1158602

Change-Id: I4d9abe378dc1ef2cf410f801ec1f480060de015a

commit_message:
Fix quota charts on the Resize Instance form

Also consolidate the template with _launch_details_help.html.

Fixes bug #1188631.

Change-Id: I5cfeccc7b7b3a4eb4027c41e3df2a99820b93706

'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2013-06-13 08:12:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(5 inline comments)

I posted a couple of comments in the code.

I wish _resolve_attribute was something better than what FnGetAtt was, in particular not needing the giant conditionals. I wonder if we could have some dispatch mechanism, like "_resolve_attribute_%s" for each attribute. This should definitely be done in a separate branch.

Related to that, this branch is too large to be comfortably reviewed, it would have been nice to split it up (and it would still be, if possible).'}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2013-06-13 12:11:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

therve: I am not convinced. Maybe some others can put their opinion in (I prefer what's there)."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-06-13 12:38:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

+1 for splitting up this patch. See https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages#Structural_split_of_changes'}, {'account_id': 7256, 'date': '2013-06-13 15:12:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: (4 inline comments)

While there are certainly a few files in this patch, the changes to individual resources are mostly trivial and generally follow the same pattern. Since this would essentially break resources without modification, I felt it preferable to update the resources at the same time rather than writing some intermediate solution that preserved old resources that would likely only be valid for a day or two.

That being said, I did avoid making more drastic changes to FnGetAttr->_resolve_attribute to minimize regression (simplest thing that could possibly work). I would agree that having some interesting implementations for __getattr__(), __setattr__(), etc would be a "good thing", but definitely something best saved for a different patch.'}, {'account_id': 7256, 'date': '2013-06-13 15:14:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 7256, 'date': '2013-06-13 15:14:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Introduce a schema for attributes

Similar to properties, adds attribute_schema and attributes members to
Resources in order to facilitate document generation and template
provider stubs for resources.

Change-Id: I5e207360816fbc685c66db68a7fab8afad11bf10
Implements: blueprint attributes-schema

commit_message:
Convert Stack to separate action/status

Next and hopefully final step in decoupling action/status

This adjusts the Stack DB columns, model and class to be consistent with
Event/Resource, and split action/status.  This also modifies the both
APIs to join the action/status to avoid changing the API

Change-Id: Ifbdf254c62cad271b775b88de5b873f4e0b6d736

commit_message:
Ensure flake8 runs with a valid settings file

The H301 check sometimes imports a file when trying to tell whether it
is a module. Ensure we run flake8 in a valid environment to avoid
any side-effects from this.

Fixes bug #1191748.

Change-Id: I35fdefcd8f4c465a89f884299a0a9f4a4c79a6f6

subject: Created Customizable Node Iterator
messages:
[{'account_id': 7736, 'date': '2013-06-18 18:19:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-06-18 18:19:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 7736, 'date': '2013-06-18 18:29:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Work In Progress

This is a work in progress, I was hoping for some feedback on the direction I'm taking. My changes don’t add any new features per se, their purpose is to make the code a little more flexible so that it is easier to add custom behavior by subclassing base Swift classes and overriding key functions. The reason that I want to do this is so that I can create extensions to Swift via subclasses that make it possible for Swift to work with Isilon storage devices. The main change that I needed to make was to how nodes are iterated in the proxy server, replicators, updaters, and the container synchronizer. So I created the NodeIterator class to implement iterating algorithm for the primary and handoff nodes rather than simply iterating the list of nodes returned by ring.get_nodes(), ring.get_more_nodes(), etc. I think this type of functionality has utility beyond my own - the write affinity change proposal comes to mind and perhaps the LFS."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-18 18:48:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/33488/2/check/gate-swift-pep8/2808 : FAILURE in 1m 36s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/33488/2/check/gate-swift-docs/2638/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 4m 41s

- http://logs.openstack.org/33488/2/check/gate-swift-python27/2884 : FAILURE in 2m 07s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33488/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/24306 : FAILURE in 13m 23s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33488/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/31763 : FAILURE in 14m 28s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33488/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/24012 : FAILURE in 13m 15s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33488/2/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/11186 : FAILURE in 21m 26s (non-voting)
"}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-06-18 21:33:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Alright, so what I'd do here is make some document somewhere else (Launchpad bug, Google doc, Etherpad, whatever) that describes the behavior you want in Swift. Gerrit is a pretty poor tool for discussions like this, IMHO.

Be sure to include some text explaining what an Isolin storage device is, as I have never seen one and have no idea what sort of behavior changes that Swift would need to work with it.

Hopefully we can figure out some way to get the needed behavior without introducing layers and layers of NodeIterationStrategyHandlerValidatorFactoryFactory classes."}, {'account_id': 7736, 'date': '2013-06-18 23:55:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-06-18 23:55:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-19 00:10:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/33488/3/check/gate-swift-pep8/2812 : FAILURE in 8s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/33488/3/check/gate-swift-docs/2642/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 00s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33488/3/check/gate-swift-python26/2890 : FAILURE in 2m 29s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33488/3/check/gate-swift-python27/2888 : FAILURE in 53s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33488/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/24431 : FAILURE in 7m 56s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33488/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/31895 : FAILURE in 8m 14s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33488/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/24137 : FAILURE in 7m 20s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33488/3/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/11292 : FAILURE in 14m 44s (non-voting)
"}, {'account_id': 7736, 'date': '2013-06-19 00:17:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Work In Progress

Still a work in progress, I updated the commit message with more information though.'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2013-06-19 05:49:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'll echo Sam's request for something that can help communicate the overall goal/direction you are looking for here.

As for notes about the specific patch, there are a few major things that stand out before getting into the code itself.

1) We use Python's pep8 for code style. The proposed patch has many violations. You can automatically find violations with https://pypi.python.org/pypi/pep8.

2) This patch has at least 3 separate feature conjoined into one large patch. At minimum, you've got the node iterator abstraction, the validator, and the metadata abstraction. These should be submitted as independent patches.

3) You've got two change-ids in the commit message. I think the first one should be deleted.

Numbers 1 and 3 should be fixable, and are simply issues around us not communicating appropriate submission guidelines or Alex not understanding them. The second issue is the most concerning to me. As-is, I would -2 this patch if it weren't marked as WIP."}, {'account_id': 7736, 'date': '2013-06-19 19:18:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Ready For Review

Thanks for the feedback. I agree that this change request should be broken up into at least three separate requests and I'll be sure to fix my coding style issues and my commit messages issues when I do re-submit them. I've also written up a document that attempts to describe the issues that I'm attempting to solve here: 

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1crYUlbb7UhwI3CRJSb9yeF1Xy_R1nYv-maS9bW2D-cU/edit?usp=sharing

Please take a look at it and let me know what you think. Email is fine or I'm also on the #openstack-swift channel as alexpec."}, {'account_id': 7736, 'date': '2013-06-19 23:19:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

Abadoning this change, instead will submit this as three separate requests.'}]

I added the NodeIterator and NodeIteratorFactory classes
in order to allow custom iteration of nodes to be implemented
in subclasses and updated the proxy-server, updaters,
replicators, and container synchronizer to use them.
Also, I added a RequestValidator class for determining if a
request is considered successful based on a consensus of
responses. Also, I added MetaDataWriter and MetaDataReader to
allow subclass customization of metadata reading and writing.
All of these changes were done because of issues that I came
upon when trying to get Swift to work with the Isilon OneFS
operating system as a storage node. By moving the functionality
from where it was to these new classes it allows me to
implement support for Isilon by subclassing.

Change-Id: I0e44941e55604cfbcd7fa063b581299ca2e506f5
'}]
commit_message:
Created Customizable Node Iterator

I added the NodeIterator and NodeIteratorFactory classes
in order to allow custom iteration of nodes to be implemented
in subclasses and updated the proxy-server, updaters,
replicators, and container synchronizer to use them.
Also, I added a RequestValidator class for determining if a
request is considered successful based on a consensus of
responses. Also, I added MetaDataWriter and MetaDataReader to
allow subclass customization of metadata reading and writing.
All of these changes were done because of issues that I came
upon when trying to get Swift to work with the Isilon OneFS
operating system as a storage node. By moving the functionality
from where it was to these new classes it allows me to
implement support for Isilon by subclassing.

Change-Id: I0e44941e55604cfbcd7fa063b581299ca2e506f5

Arata: By encode with '%' are you suggesting we use '%20' for spaces instead? The '+' seemed simpler so I used it... also by me reading using the '+' is the way to go when sending application/x-www-form-urlencoded POST requests.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/URL_encoding#The_application.2Fx-www-form-urlencoded_type

I've tested what is here now functionally and it seems to work fine."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-06-19 23:09:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Clint: So I had checked on the httpd option and my version of Ubuntu (12.10) doesn't seem to have it. And by doesn't have it I mean when a boot up a deploy ramdisk running Busybox v1.19.3 (Ubuntu 1:1.19.3-7ubuntu1.1) commands trying to use httpd -e fail with:

httpd: invalid option -- 'e'

Note that that feature is optional (ENABLE_FEATURE_HTTPD_ENCODE_URL_STR would need to be enabled) so perhaps older Ubuntu's leave it disabled?

If our requirement is to work with older (less capable) Ubuntu busybox defaults we might be best to avoid this for now."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-19 23:09:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

Clint: Patchset 5 formats the safe_url_encode function w/ tabs. Note my previous comments about not using 'httpd' for encoding for now due to deficiencies in the Ubuntu 12.10 busybox options.

Arata: I removed the '=' from the error message you were concerned with. Thanks."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-06-19 23:09:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3068, 'date': '2013-06-19 23:09:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

No, I thought of '=', which appear in the message for BOOT_MAC_ADDRESS (I marked it with inline comment)."}, {'account_id': 3068, 'date': '2013-06-19 23:09:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Cloud not use '%' in encode? The others lgtm."}, {'account_id': 3068, 'date': '2013-06-19 23:09:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Colon is skipped but it doesn't seem to cause a problem. LGTM"}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-06-19 23:09:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-06-19 23:09:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but whitespace content has changed.'}, {'account_id': 6449, 'date': '2013-06-19 23:09:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-06-19 23:09:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Minor formatting nit.

Also, I wonder if we shouldn't just make use of busybox's more advanced features:

http://git.busybox.net/busybox/tree/networking/httpd.c

This suggests you can do

message=$(httpd -e "your message")

Which works on my Ubuntu 13.04 box:

$ busybox httpd -e "dobrý ve?er"
dobrÃ½ veÄer'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-06-19 23:09:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-06-19 23:09:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

It is not that Ubuntu's version is older, it is that the initramfs version of busybox is built with almost everything turned off, presumably to reduce the size of the initramfs.

This minimal implementation should be fine."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-19 23:09:22.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-19 23:09:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified

commit_message:
Add mechanism to send error messages to helper.

Adds a new err_msg function which is used to:

-echo feedback to the deploy ramdisk console
-keep track of the first error message we hit so
 that we can send it along to the baremetal-deploy-helper.

Also, updates our wget request back to baremetal-deploy-helper
to include the first the first error message (if any) as
the 'e' parameter.

The err_msg uses a new simple safe_url_encode function to ensure
we don't send invalid characters in our HTTP post requests.

Change-Id: I5a623a6f66cde8d81ff1e75800dc2953ca2703a8

commit_message:
Restore babel setup config options

Restore the babel configuration values from setup.cfg before the pbr
change so that you can compile the message catalog using "python
setup.py compile_catalog" again.

Fixes bug 1192685

Change-Id: I6db624940b7b8017700e8d2bc7ba56ba4295f091

commit_message:
Adds upgrade warning for token_format.

  This commit will add a warning under the Limitations section to inform
  people of the change from UUID to PKI as the default token format.

Change-Id: I086215a256cf82f45e9793bb157a0cf5c59ac3d0

commit_message:
Configure iptables on Fedora.

In order to have a Fedora bootstrap node we have to configure iptables
to allow the openstack services to be externally accessed, baremetal
nodes to be able to pxe boot and mount the ISCSI target.

Change-Id: I956a84e6ac1149d2cc0e3720d24fd619cec2e472

Ensure request media-types are sane

This ensures both the Accept and Content-Type headers have
agreeable values.

commit_message:
Restore metadata access in boot-stack.

In the addition of overcloud support we broke boot-stack by
configuring nova to use a metadata-proxy (bug 1191714).

Change-Id: If721af41e4d17a614aa03683f870b0829e4cf292

commit_message:
Adding element to get source for elements.

Fixes bug 1184943

Adding an element that allows other elements to register
repositories it would like to be retrieved for it.

Doing this outside of the chroot allows locally cached
repositories to be used. It also gives the ability to d-i-b
to specify what revision to use if an alternative to the
most recent is required.

Effectively allowing a CI system to test d-i-b and elements
without being effected by unavailable git repositories or
breakages in actively developed source code being used by
the elements.

Change-Id: I1527facebaad256a357af680e017b34b1788575d

the things we might want to do when something bad happens.

The new troubleshooting function also makes use of a new
'troubleshoot' kernel param which if specific will allow you to

via a bash shell on a console.

commit_message:
Make bash troubleshooting configurable

Adds a new 'troubleshooting' function which encapsulates
the things we might want to do when something bad happens.
Typically this is echo'ing a simple message and launching a
bash shell.

The new troubleshooting function also makes use of a new
'troubleshoot' kernel param which if specific will allow you to
hang the deployment process and interactively debug the deploy_ramdisk
via a bash shell on a console.

Troubleshoot is disabled by default.

Fixes LP Bug #1191043.

Change-Id: I2cba8a9674075ba7e420027d40ef8cbe756cf07e

commit_message:
Make the finalise_base function less Ubuntu-ish.

The finalise_base function was creating a broken link at /etc/resolv.conf
when building a non ubuntu image.

Change-Id: I974d43fd6db365dbff9c85195e3b72950f3409da

[{'created': '2013-06-19 00:03:53.000000000', 'message': "Make TempURL more cache-efficient.

So, there's two cases here. In one case, we have memcache enabled;
account info gets cached in the usual place, and tempurl keys get
cached separately. In the other case, we have no cache. In neither
case does is anything gained by having TempURL caching keys separately
from the account info.

This commit removes TempURL's custom caching logic and makes it rely
on get_account_info() instead.

Benefits include:
 * immediate visibility of new keys on account POST
 * less data in the cache per account --> more stuff fits in cache
 * less code for bugs to hide in

Change-Id: Idb0b6c165da14196b4c79149c546f0159b54edcb
"}, {'created': '2013-06-19 18:46:52.000000000', 'message': "Make TempURL more cache-efficient.

So, there's two cases here. In one case, we have memcache enabled;
account info gets cached in the usual place, and tempurl keys get
cached separately. In the other case, we have no cache. In neither
case is anything gained by having TempURL cache keys separately from
the account info.

This commit removes TempURL's custom caching logic and makes it rely
on get_account_info() instead.

Benefits include:
 * immediate visibility of new keys on account POST
 * less data in the cache per account --> more stuff fits in cache
 * less code for bugs to hide in

Change-Id: Idb0b6c165da14196b4c79149c546f0159b54edcb
"}]
commit_message:
Make TempURL more cache-efficient.

So, there's two cases here. In one case, we have memcache enabled;
account info gets cached in the usual place, and tempurl keys get
cached separately. In the other case, we have no cache. In neither
case is anything gained by having TempURL cache keys separately from
the account info.

This commit removes TempURL's custom caching logic and makes it rely
on get_account_info() instead.

Benefits include:
 * immediate visibility of new keys on account POST
 * less data in the cache per account --> more stuff fits in cache
 * less code for bugs to hide in

Change-Id: Idb0b6c165da14196b4c79149c546f0159b54edcb

commit_message:
Discard possibly expired token before re-authenticating

Fixes bug 1192656

Previously, the attempt to re-authenticate on possible token
expiry actually re-used the expired token, which was clearly
bound to fail in the expired case.

Now the old authentication state is discarded before attempting
re-authentication.

Change-Id: I3fd125702061f7ac84eb501d2a488aab5b2385b9

commit_message:
Retry the sfdisk command up to 3 times.

Updates the nova baremetal-deploy-helper so that we retry
the fdisk command up to 3 times.

Previously the command would sometimes intermittently fail with
'Device or resource busy' errors. There doesn't seem to be a good way
to check/verify this other than to retry.

Fixes LP Bug #1191084.

Change-Id: I9c0733432dee5d556d6d2460db42f844e277c8de

Variable names referring to the same objects/data are different
throughout the libvirt driver. This can lead to confusion, which
leads to avoidable bugs.

Part1:
    ctxt -> context
    instance_ref -> instance

Change-Id: I9d170b6025935544f07ecdebe5a68b2e2eaba5dd
'}, {'created': '2013-06-19 17:39:54.000000000', 'message': 'Libvirt driver: normalize variable names (part1)

commit_message:
Libvirt driver: normalize variable names (part1)

Variable names referring to the same objects/data are different
throughout the libvirt driver. This can lead to confusion, which
leads to avoidable bugs.

Part1:
    ctxt -> context
    instance_ref -> instance

Change-Id: I9d170b6025935544f07ecdebe5a68b2e2eaba5dd

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-11 04:24:29.000000000', 'message': 'Added functionality to return list of rabbit hosts

In the process of adding this functionality, refactored the way search
occurs, so we can use a genericized method.
  * Added `#rabbit_servers` method, which returns a list of rabbit servers.
  * The `#memcached_servers` method no longer accepts an environment.
  * Re-factored methods which search to a generic `#search_for`.
  * Updated the tests which were modified to the new rspec expect syntax.

Change-Id: Ifb4dd793f47a6b7529c5fa9e65895d1bcab8f7b3
'}]
commit_message:
Added functionality to return list of rabbit hosts

In the process of adding this functionality, refactored the way search
occurs, so we can use a genericized method.
  * Added `#rabbit_servers` method, which returns a list of rabbit servers.
  * The `#memcached_servers` method no longer accepts an environment.
  * Re-factored methods which search to a generic `#search_for`.
  * Updated the tests which were modified to the new rspec expect syntax.

Change-Id: Ifb4dd793f47a6b7529c5fa9e65895d1bcab8f7b3

commit_message:
skip test_ec2_instance_run.InstanceRunTest.test_integration_1

this test is not functioning in a quantum environment, and has
been reseting the gate for the last week. Skip until it can be
made to work in a quantum environment like the gate.

Change-Id: I155d38b8aa5a570a0914bc8519b8f24413145261

commit_message:
Fill context on objects in lists

This fixes object lists to not contain orphaned objects after
making an RPC trip.

Fixes bug 1191113

Change-Id: Ia90321da2f480835e1c7213a52eb5731840dbd6a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-09 10:00:16.000000000', 'message': 'Swift tests for unicode headers

Swift functional tests sends ilegal headers (unicode) and expects
these headers to be processed by Swift.

Apache2 seem to remove such headers which is a sound behavior for
illegal headers.

This change restrict the test tpo exist only for swift integral
web front end. For future it is advised to disallow such behaviour.
For example it is suggested to make the decission that in future APIs
illegal headers are removed rather than processed.

Change-Id: Ibf548f474de3f06a2687f8f4812beaeaf81ab216
Fixes: Bug #1189123
'}]
commit_message:
Swift tests for unicode headers

Swift functional tests sends ilegal headers (unicode) and expects
these headers to be processed by Swift.

Apache2 seem to remove such headers which is a sound behavior for
illegal headers.

This change restrict the test tpo exist only for swift integral
web front end. For future it is advised to disallow such behaviour.
For example it is suggested to make the decission that in future APIs
illegal headers are removed rather than processed.

Change-Id: Ibf548f474de3f06a2687f8f4812beaeaf81ab216
Fixes: Bug #1189123
